reviews.review_msg: In order to access this course, we first had to complete almost 50 quizzes and modules on plagiarism and academic integrity. 50. It took me almost 4 hours. This is by far the most tedious, mindnumbing prof I've ever had. She assigns a massive amount of meaningless work that doesn't teach you anything (like literally copying and pasting stuff).
She's the nicest and her courses are always so positive and inspiring. If you get the chance to take a class with her, I highly recommend it.
One of the sweetest people ever! Her online course was fairly easy and allowed for a lot of flexibility.
The course is more tedious than anything; lots of writing. 8 assignments 10-20% each. If you put a decent amount of effort in and communicate with your TA it's an easy A.

Weird course with lots of reflective and artistic assignments. Course is composed of quite a few assignments that are worth 10-20% and one is due nearly every week. Requires a certain level of effort and care, but shouldn't be too difficult if you're comfortable with reflective/creative assignments.

She's one of the sweetest people you will ever meet. Her stories can go on for the entire class, but it doesn't even matter, because they are so entertaining. Educ 100 is definitely a GPA booster and I haven't said that about any class before. Strangely, my writing skills drastically improved after the final paper because of her editing. Wonderful!

Just take this class if you need a GPA boost!  All assignments are easy to do and are quite often based on your thoughts and experiences. No final exam, just a take home exam and all you have to do is create a rubric and evaluate a portfolio you made in class using the assigments already done in the course! You'll have no stress if you take it!
Awesome class if you're interested in delving into self reflection as a means of becoming a better teacher.
Unclear grading criteria, spends way too long talking about useless things, but I guess the assignments are easy
didn't even get a good mark. too much for for an easy class

Have taken two classes of hers so far online. Her approach to teaching an online classroom is thorough and clear. Her syllabus walks you through progressively. Her storytelling allows for practical understanding and meaningful interpretation. She is good at what she does and she has developed her courses with authority and quality.

Online course. I've never contacted her, always contacted her TA who was awesome (but it's not him who I am grading). Also, the website wasn't well, I always had to go to different places to get all this information I needed for an assignment, and I contacted my TA for most of them. If she still has the same TA as I've had, you'll be just fine.

Very time consuming. Project/paper due almost every... single... week... It will leave you with no time for other classes, or a social life for that matter. Basically a lot of work for very little reward in terms of knowledge and GPA (I walked out with a C+)

She was the best Prof I've ever had. By far the best class I've ever taken in university. It took me a while to get used to her way of grading and what she expected, but I learned more from this amazing woman than anyone else in university. She's absolutely wonderful!!!

EDUC 326 is  a complete joke.  I don't feel I learned anything about classroom management and discipline.  All we did was a bunch of ridiculous self-reflection. Total fluff!  We were continually graded on our self-reflection! The marking scheme is also inconsistent.  BAD course!

Avoid this class! The grading scale is extremely high. 85 is a B? The assignments are marked too academically. I've consistently received A's in upper division writing courses, but did not receive any mark higher than 8.5/10 on the assignments, even when I worked my butt off.
excellent prof!!!! very helpful!!!! She changed my life!!!!!

Carolyn is one of the sweetest person alive. she's very passionate about teaching and cares about all her students!!! Educ 199 is definitely one of the best courses i've taken at SFU.  workload consist of an individual project, group project, 3 narratives, attendance/participation.

I took her online course and found out she designed the course to be a complete act of hypocrisy.  The class entitled "Classroom Management" was based almost entirely on Type theory.  Although in her notes she talks about the importance of getting to know students, she made no effort at all to be involved with that class.
okay class
Carolyn embodies "high ceilings, low floors."  She is both interested and interesting.  She is someone I will always respect and admire.

Not a fan. I took her correspondence course on classroom management and was disappointed to find the ENTIRE course was based on type theory and fluffy little personal narratives from her life with absolutely NO practical information on classroom management. Easy grading, but useless course.

Idealistic, passionate, and zealous...not in a good way.  The course was biased, unbalanced, and I got a B on my huge portfolio assignment, dragging down what could have been 95% overall to 87%.  And mostly because I had trouble taking any of the material seriously.
No Comments

Professor Mamchur is a dangerous presence on campus, in my opinion. I have never met a more arrogant, domineering, thoroughly brainwashed individual in my life. She is a devout convert to Jungian Type Theory and refuses to deal with anyone until they've been appropriately labelled. My advice? Refuse the test; it's illegal. Report her to the press.

She's a complete nut job. Quit categorizing people by there "type". Not everyone likes to told what they are before talking or getting to know them. Her Jesuit priest story is completely inappropriate; wait til' you hear it.
Carolyn is a mentor and friend. Engage her, get to know her, and you will be rewarded. I took PDP with her in 1988. She changed my life.

Mamchur is great. She's very entertaining and funny and she uses stories and anecdotes to teach. She is a genuinely warm and caring person and I still remember her years after taking a few classes with her! She's one in a million!
Easy A I've ever gotten!!!!!!
No Comments
